seeWorkingExample: To see a working example, see the example code on gitHub, part of the vs solution.
step 1: Instantiate class BigExcelWriter using either a file path or a stream (When using a stream, using MemoryStream is recommended, although you may use a different type of stream if you need to).
step 3 note: If you want to hide a row, pass true when calling BeginRow
step 4: Between BeginRow and EndRow, use WriteTextCell to write a cell.
step 4 note1: Alternatively, you can use WriteTextRow to write an entire row at once, using the same format.
step 4 note2: Starting on version 1.1, text cells can be written using the shared strings table, which should reduce the generated file size. See {{projects.BigExcelCreator.usage.shared strings}} below
step 6: Use WriteNumberCell or WriteNumberRow to insert numbers. This is useful if you need to do any calculation later on.
step 8: If needed, repeat steps 2 â†’ 5 to write to another sheet
shared strings text: If the same text appears across different sheets, using the shared strings table may help reduce the generated file size. In order to do this, simply set to true the useSharedStrings parameter when calling WriteTextCell or WriteTextRow.
